name: humanist
content:
Add to word list

a person who believes in humanism (= the idea that people do not need a god or religion to satisfy their spiritual and emotional needs): She is a liberal and a humanist. I respected him as a man of exceptional moral stature and a humanist. See
humanism
More examplesFewer examplesHe was a humanist, an urbanist, and, above all, an artist. Among the first targets of the Spanish Inquisition were the humanists. A group of self-proclaimed humanists came out in defence of cloning.

relating to or believing in humanism (= the idea that people do not need a god or religion to satisfy their spiritual and emotional needs): Both men come from a humanist tradition.
More examplesFewer examplesThe article was published in a humanist journal. She received a humanist education. What people mean by "progressive" or "humanist" often is not clear.
